issues.description: ExcellenceLand's constructor parameter order in the solution does not follow the UML / problem statement requirement. The problem explicitly requires a public constructor that takes all attributes defined in the UML in the same order as they appear (first attribute on top => first parameter). The UML lists ExcellenceLand attributes as: 1) excellencyLevel: double, 2) excellentEnough: boolean, and the association 'rides' (List<Ride>) â€” therefore the constructor parameters should be (double excellencyLevel, boolean excellentEnough, List<Ride> rides). The solution, however, declares the constructor as (List<Ride> rides, boolean excellentEnough, double excellencyLevel). This mismatch contradicts the stated constructor-order requirement and will confuse students and/or cause automated tests that check parameter order to fail.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the ExcellenceLand constructor parameter order to match the UML attribute order. For example: public ExcellenceLand(double excellencyLevel, boolean excellentEnough, List<Ride> rides) { this.excellencyLevel = excellencyLevel; this.excellentEnough = excellentEnough; this.rides = rides; } Ensure the constructor parameters are declared in the same sequence as the UML (excellencyLevel, excellentEnough, rides).
